problem_text:
(R. C. Lyndon). b) Is it true that a ̸= 1 in G = ⟨a, x | a5 = 1, ax2 = [a, ax]⟩?
V. V. Bludov
answer: Yes, it is true, since the mapping a →(1 3 5 2 4), x →(1 2 4 3 5) can be extended to a homomorphism of the group G onto the alternating group A5 (D. N. Azarov, in: Algebraicheskije Systemy, Ivanovo, 1991, 4–5 (Russian)).
